website_summaries.verdict: Bariatric crutches using supportive arm cuffs are much more comfortable for certain patients than traditional underarm crutches. If weight is an issue, this is a set to consider first, especially right after surgery.
pros: Ideal for weight-related mobility issues and chronic muscular illnesses
cons: Arm cuffs aren't proportional to many bariatric patients
Quality control concerns about arm cuffs and expansion tubes
Confusion over 1 or 2 crutches per order

customer_reviews.title: Great Product .. Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product multiple times and will do so again I'm happy with this product overall, as someone who has used forearm crutches for 45 years I have tried many brands and these seem to be well made and durable for the most part. The only criticism is that the rubberized coating on the cuffs is too thin and has already started to split on the edges after only a little more than a week but overal the crutches hold up well. I would recommend these crutches to anyone searching for an affordable yet durable pair of crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: They're Great!
customer_reviews.text: They work fine. I like them better than the axillary crutches I was using previously. I'm on my second pair - bent one when I fell on it (there was a piece of paper on the floor that was the same color as the carpet, the crutch tip stuck to the paper fine, but the paper slipped).
customer_reviews.author: JSR

customer_reviews.title: Love Drive products but disappointed in this one.
customer_reviews.text: Having MS I have had a variety of Drive products through the years. These were my first set of forearm crutches. Being 350 lbs I figured bariactric forearm crutches would be a good starting point to get walking again. Had to return them because I couldn't get my arms through the cuffs far enough to reach the handle grips. I thought since they were bariatric and support up to 500 lbs. the cuffs would be bigger due to the weight they supported but not the case. Still love drive products just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: michael taylor

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: RUBBER PEELING OFF OF THE CUFFS THAT GO AROUND FORARM
customer_reviews.author: Ed G.

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Durable rubber feet.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the gold standard. Solid product. Am 240lbs and these got me through an Ortho femur repair and then through full Total Hip Replacement.
customer_reviews.author: James Kay

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I was confused at first about how the arm bands were adjustable, then my husband said you just pull or push the bands to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Sickles

customer_reviews.title: Being able to walk
customer_reviews.text: Best Best Best thing i have purchased in a very long time. These crutches have allowed me to get into my house and become an active member of society after my amputation. 10 out of 10
customer_reviews.author: KensAmazon4840

customer_reviews.title: Work good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. He likes them, they offer good support.
customer_reviews.author: D. Laird

customer_reviews.title: Light weight n easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to keep my balance while walking. They are light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have  The stability that I need.
customer_reviews.text: I changed over to the scratches from Canes. They give me this stability then I need to walk and get me where I need to be .
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Suah

customer_reviews.title: They are not pretty
customer_reviews.text: So far the are excellent and it just took a couple of minutes to get used to the extra weight. Very solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a great price
customer_reviews.text: They work better for my husband than his regular crutches did, and fit better in a vehicle. He does wish they were a couple of inches taller, but the price was much better than the other quote we got.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Jean Evans

customer_reviews.title: They work, but I've had better
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in a timely manner, thank you. Over the course of 50 years on crutches, the quality and design of these products has steadily declined in favor of cheaper and lower quality. I guess there is not much profit in a lot of durable medical goods.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, these are truly heavy duty. excellent shipping ordered these one day got them the next morning. adjusted them and I am entirely satisfied. item is exactly as stated in AD.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Crutch grip height does not fit 6'-2" height!
customer_reviews.text: Grips are 2" too low for a 6'-2" tall person. Since I cannot get a pair to fit that meet my weight requirement of 500#, I will have to pay to have two additional holes drilled to raise the grip height.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Walters

customer_reviews.title: Good solid crutches
customer_reviews.text: Good solid crutches, cuffs ridiculously small. Bent them more open to accommodate my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Martin

customer_reviews.title: These are my go to crutches. I use them ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to crutches. I use them heavily and they last the longest of any I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn E. Walder

customer_reviews.title: Light and strong.
customer_reviews.text: These canes are sturdy and moves with me pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric Hill

customer_reviews.title: Got a new set..
customer_reviews.text: I got these for myself I have CP I can use these well. They last a good time for me, with the amount of moments I do in a day worth.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon atkinson

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and durable a must for a larger person
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and durable a must for a larger person. Hated the reason for the need, but loved being able to depend on a good product. Don't rely on a light weight product.
customer_reviews.author: dog lover

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the crutches, I am now more mobile :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rainy

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable, sturdy forearm crutches. Made for larger people.
customer_reviews.author: Trish White

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with them even happier with the price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with them even happier with the price. Had I gone to the medical supply place that my doctor sent me through with prescription would’ve cost me double the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: These crutches were just what I needed for when I can't find a motorized cart. Very comfortable to use. I keep them in the car with me all the time.
customer_reviews.author: sharon voltz

customer_reviews.title: good construction. My in-law appreciated these as the walker ...
customer_reviews.text: good construction. My in-law appreciated these as the walker he was using slowed him down too much. pro: 1. right length 2. strong construction 3 easy to store Con: 1. needs to have 4" base crutch tips (everything else is too small).
customer_reviews.author: visionlessone

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Stable, sturdy, and soooo much better than the common WW2-era armpit crutches!
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: hardware exposed and scratches hand, wrists and arms when sliding arms through arm braces.
customer_reviews.author: ray santos

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality at a Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a good quality, heavy duty forearm crutch at a very reasonable price. We are pleased with it's performance and construction.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell Wild

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's too heavy and not at all what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Naes187

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT bariatric forearm crutches. They are sturdy and stable but the cuffs are quite small and cannot be adjusted. I reached out to Drive Medical to ask if they had replacement cuffs in a larger size and their simple answer was no. I can’t use these without bruises showing up on my arms within minutes. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Lady

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this Excellent product, delivery, packaging for this heavy duty, bariatric 500 lb. limit forearm crutches
customer_reviews.text: Excellent delivery with crutches in original box also placed in another shipping box. Looks brand new and very heavy duty for a bariatric 500 lb. limit patient Large cuff in vinyl coating, I was able to carefully widen them for my large forearm. Solid vinyl coating on hand grips. Both upper forearm part and bottom leg part have push button holes to adjust length and both have a tightening adapter to keep from raddling. I am very pleased with this product, delivery, packaging. All other questions are listed in either questions or comments if you have never used forearm crutches before.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Sharpton

customer_reviews.title: Freedom comes in another form...
customer_reviews.text: It is so wonderful to be able to ambulate again! These are much more comfortable than 'underarm' crutches. They are very sturdy, adjustable for comfort and for hieght. Didn't take much 'getting used to' at all. I was actually using two canes when my pain physician nixed then in hurry. Ordered these and I can understand why. These are much more secure-feeling. It is a little tougher to carry anything than with my canes... so I adapt and wear a lightweight shoulder bag to carry things from point A to point B. I let my 82-year-old Dad try them and subsequently got him a pair as well. He,too, is very pleased with them. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SLV

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I get about 6 months out if a set, if I am lucky. My biggest issue is the cuffs break and the coating wears off. I have not been able to find replacement cuffs.
customer_reviews.author: Juke

customer_reviews.title: Where is the quality control?
customer_reviews.text: The tips of both crutches are falling off, rendering these crutches useless. They also stick to the floor and and stay while the crutch pulls out. Not safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: JR06

customer_reviews.title: Solid easy to adjust and reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Great price, less hassle than renting. Handy to have around. Solid for larger folks but not too heavy, easy to use. Once again love that medical assistive devices are available with PRIME shipping. Easy to adjust, person using these 6'1" so works for taller folks.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska lady

customer_reviews.title: these are as good a quality for half the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my sister-she has used forearm crutches her entire life. The last pair she bought were well over $150.....these are as good a quality for half the price. She is very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: SHANNON CONNORS

customer_reviews.title: Another helping aid for walking.
customer_reviews.text: I had a very bad MS ascerbation and so I ordered one of these crutches. Don't know what I would have done without it. It really allowed me to walk and become mobile. Would strongly reccomend this product for anyone who is having trouble walking or moving around. Extremely well built and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: LSL

customer_reviews.title: For heavy duty people!
customer_reviews.text: Could be better, for me the cuffs could be bigger They don't fit my arms. other than that it's built good, nice looking, and so much nicer than old wood crutches. Lighter too.
customer_reviews.author: 55Terry

customer_reviews.title: Forget regular canes, go with these fantastic European style canes
customer_reviews.text: regular canes caused me so much shoulder pain but I needed the stability. My ortho specialist recommended this type of cane and what an incredible difference in stability and in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: DebraDownSthTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: they aren't made of sturdy enough material
customer_reviews.text: One broke the other bent, they aren't made of sturdy enough material.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Agreed, best buy
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews, that these are as advertized, work great, delivered as expected. Thank you for a spot-on product.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Livi

customer_reviews.title: forearm crutch
customer_reviews.text: Crutches are strong. But after three weeks the tips are about shot and the covers on the c buffs is wearing and splitting
customer_reviews.author: korpi

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty steel forearm crutches
customer_reviews.text: These Heavy duty bariatric steel forearm crutches were purchased for a person recovering from a stroke and proved to be a great help.
customer_reviews.author: Betty. R

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy crutches. I am a big man, and these give me great support.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Allgood

customer_reviews.title: far superior. You have complete control
customer_reviews.text: Throw away your under-arm crutches. They are dangerous. This product is far, far superior. You have complete control.
customer_reviews.author: Baja Guali

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: The crutches are heavy duty...the nuts have worked off on both arm bands...had to replace with new. Working great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Colisa Onderbeke

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled, this is only one crutch, not a pair.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This is a great product. That being said, there is only ONE crutch. Despite the term crutches and the question and answer section that states this is a pair, IT IS NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drive medical
customer_reviews.text: This product took more than two weeks to arrive and when it did it was not as ordered. I placed an order for CHROME forearm canes and the ones that arrived were black. In addition they were very heavy and did not fit my forarms but hit my elbows on the shortest adjusted position. When I sent them back the company sent me a refund but deducted 40% for a restocking fee even though the product was not as ordered. I WOULD NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hastings

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Forearm Crutch, Chrome, Bariatric (1-Pair)
product_meta.description: Experience the enhanced mobiltiy that comes with Forearm Crutches from Drive Medical. The heavy duty crutches accommodate patients up to 500 lbs. and feature independently adjustable forearm and leg section for optimal sizing. The vinyl coated arm cuffs and handles ensure comfortable use.
feature_bullets: ergonomically contoured arm cuffs molded for comfort and stability
Leg and forearm sections adjust independently for optimal sizing
Vinyl hand grips are comfortable and durable
Handle Height: 28"-37"; Recommended User Height: 60"-74";Weight Capacity: 500 lbs

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
